comments.body: Why is this info in the readme instead of in the docs?
Because it is not ready to be used by external people.

comments.body: This deletion seems a little overzealous to me; excising the second sentence from the last paragraph and the second paragraph after the first sentence seems entirely accurate.

diffHunk:
@@ -35,18 +35,6 @@ as run from the main project root directory (adjust the location of the JAR acco
   --help                   Print the usage text
 ```
 
-# Compatibility
-
-Sandbox uses models compiled in to the DAR format.
-
-The dar files are the archives containing compiled DAML code. We highly recommend generating the dar files using the new DAML packaging, as described in https://engineering.da-int.net/docs/da-all-docs/packages/daml-project/. This will ensure that you're generating the .dar files correctly. The linked page also gives a good overview of what the dar files are, along with other key concepts.
-
-Note that the new Ledger API only supports DAML 1.0 or above codebases compiled to DAML-LF v1. Again, using the DAML packaging as suggested above will ensure that you are generating dar files that the Sandbox can consume.
-
-# Ledger API
-
-The new Ledger API uses gRPC. You can find the full documentation of all the services involved rendered at http://ci.da-int.net/job/ledger-api/job/build/job/master/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/ledger-api/grpc-definitions/target/docs/index.html (save the file locally to get the styling to work). If you just want to create / exercise contracts, I suggest you start by looking at `command_service.proto`, which exposes a synchronous API to the DAML ledger. 
-

comments.body: System parameters don't play nice with the daml assistant, as far as I know. @associahedron, is this correct?
AFAIK there's no way to set them at the moment when running via `daml`. Both command-line options and environment variables would work though.
My suggestion: use an environment variable `SANDBOX_LOG_LEVEL` or so.
@gerolf-da Any ideas how to thread through an env variable `$SANDBOX_LOG_LEVEL` into logback configuration? Happy to do it if I get a hint how to
You could also do both -- if `-Dsandbox-log-level` is set, use that, otherwise use `SANDBOX_LOG_LEVEL`?
I would rather make it a regular command line option. This mechanism is known to work. ~You can set system properties prior to initializing the logging system.~

There are 2 examples on how to set the log level programmatically in [Java Codegen](https://github.com/digital-asset/daml/blob/master/language-support/java/codegen/src/main/scala/com/digitalasset/daml/lf/codegen/CodeGenRunner.scala#L32-L39) and [Scala Codegen](https://github.com/digital-asset/daml/blob/master/language-support/scala/codegen/src/main/scala/com/digitalasset/codegen/Main.scala#L33-L41)

diffHunk:
@@ -45,3 +45,13 @@ Note that the new Ledger API only supports DAML 1.0 or above codebases compiled
 # Ledger API
 
 The new Ledger API uses gRPC. You can find the full documentation of all the services involved rendered at http://ci.da-int.net/job/ledger-api/job/build/job/master/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/ledger-api/grpc-definitions/target/docs/index.html (save the file locally to get the styling to work). If you just want to create / exercise contracts, I suggest you start by looking at `command_service.proto`, which exposes a synchronous API to the DAML ledger. 
+
+# Logging
+
+You can enable debug logging in Sandbox with `sandbox-log-level` system property:
+
+    $ java -Dsandbox-log-level=DEBUG -jar ./bazel-bin/ledger/sandbox/sandbox-binary_deploy.jar $PWD/bazel-bin/ledger/sandbox/Test.dar
